item.title: My first communication, via LinkedIn, to Donald Alway, Assistant Director in Charge of the Los Angeles FBI Field Office
item.description: Click this link to see the original LinkedIn post. From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Date sent: May 29, 2023, 08:50 (Beijing time) To: Donald Alway (Assistant Director in Charge, FBI) Dear Mr. Don Alway, thank you for sharing the message of Director Wray. I watched it with genuine interest. I sincerely hope the FBI doesn’t underestimate the harm done by white-collar criminals. Director Wray omitted to mention financial crime but financial crimes often end up causing very significant harm to society including lots of premature deaths.

item.title: Email to Adam Rogalski. Special Agent in Charge? FBI case number? FBI Victim Specialist?
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Special Agent in Charge? FBI case number? FBI Victim Specialist? Date sent：2023-01-27 17:32 (Beijing time +0800) To: Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department) Cc: Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist), Edward Lehman, and many more people (I will try to update this section soon) My reference for this case: USA-v-McDonalds-pattern-of-racketeering-activity Dear Mr. Rogalski, As a victim of the transnational criminal enterprise orchestrated by the criminal entity McDonald’s Corporation, I would like to ask you three questions:

item.title: Email to French law professor Yves Strickler
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: : Bonne Année! Date sent: January 27, 2023, 16:53 (Beijing time) To: Yves Strickler (French law professor) Cc: Many people including the FBI and the State Department, I will update this section later Dear Professor Strickler, Thank you for reminding me to pay close attention to compliance. You are absolutely right! Please don’t worry if you don’t immediately have the time to read all of the emails I am CCing to you regarding the pattern of racketeering activity McDonald’s Corporation has engaged into.

item.title: UPDATING - SEC Office of the Whistleblower, second complaint submitted on November 15, 2022
item.description: THIS IS BEING UPDATED; PLEASE COME BACK AT A LATER TIME (As of 2023-04-15, it’s currently not my priority any longer to finish updating this page. But if you have questions regarding this submission to the SEC, please feel free to contact me at x@ecthrwatch.org). I ADDED THIS ENTRY ON JANUARY 20, 2023. I WILL TRY TO ADD MORE INFORMATION SOON. SOME IMPORTANT NAMES ARE NOT INCLUDED YET IN THE LIST I SUBMITTED TO THE SEC, LIKE WHITE-COLLAR CRIMINAL NAWFAL TRABELSI.

item.title: Request for anonymity - European Court of Human Rights - McDonald’s RICO case
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: request_for_anonymity_2022-11-01_Redacted.pdf This request for anonymity was submitted to the European Court of Human Rights by fax to +33 390214350 on October 31, 2022, at 17:06:23 (GMT), or November 01, 2022, at 01:06 (am) Beijing time. My request for anonymity was approved by the European Court of Human Rights on November 02, 2022. However, I didn’t receive the notification by email they claim to have sent me on that day.

item.title: Request for interim measures - European Court of Human Rights - McDonald’s RICO case
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original email: request_for_interim_measures_2022-10-31_Redacted.pdf This request for interim measures was submitted to the European Court of Human Rights by fax to +33 390214350 on October 31, 2022, at 15:09:09 (GMT), or 23:09 Beijing time. Click on this link to visualize the original email: request_for_interim_measures_2022-10-31_Redacted.pdf

item.title: 2-page Statement of Facts in the McDonald’s RICO/PORA/FCPA case sent to Edward Lehman
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: 2-page_statement-of-facts_mcdonalds_rico_pora_fcpa_case_Redacted.pdf Statement of Facts - selected events | Memorandum n°2-2022-10-24_2_pages_only | Date: October 24, 2022 To: Edward LEHMAN (contact email: [REDACTED]) From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) (contact email: [REDACTED] phone +86-[REDACTED]) Subject: RICO, FCPA, pattern of racketeering activity by McDonald’s Corporation and its subsidiary companies Summary: McDonald’s Corporation and its subsidiary companies have engaged, for years, in a pattern of racketeering activity, money laundering, and corruption of at least one French official.

item.title: Reply from Constant Méheut, journalist for The New York Times
item.description: From: Constant Méheut (NYTimes) Subject: New York Times Date received: 2022-05-31 at 18:24 Beijing time To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Note: the email has been redacted for privacy. Also, READ THIS: https://www.tojournalists.com/open-letters/explanations-sent-to-constant-meheut-may-25-2022/ Dear Mr. X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court), Thank you very much for your emails. To be honest, I have to admit it’s a little bit difficult to follow and I am not sure I understand, yet, the link between everything you told me so far.

item.title: Explanations sent to New York Times journalist Constant Méheut
item.description: EXCERPT FROM THE EXPLANATIONS I SENT TO NEW YORK TIMES JOURNALIST CONSTANT MÉHEUT, ON MAY 25 2022 BETWEEN APPROXIMATELY 7:36 PM AND 8:05 PM (BEIJING TIME), BY DIRECT MESSAGING VIA TWITTER. SOME OF THE MESSAGES HAVE BEEN REDACTED FOR READABILITY. PLEASE REFER TO THE FRENCH VERSION IF YOU WANT TO READ THE ORIGINAL VERSION. […] (NOTE: I removed, for brevity, some of the initial messages I sent) There are also other documents that prove that the McDonald’s Monopoly has a huge effect on sales.

item.title: Sending the F.B.I. my reference for the case targeting McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering + additional warnings
item.description:
On 2022-04-28, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to give them my reference for the case targeting the transnational criminal enterprise McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering.

I am also reminding the F.B.I. that the law firm representing McDonald’s France was Péchenard & Associés, a law firm which belongs to and/or used to belong to the parents of the former General Director of the French National Police.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department)

SUBJECT: Case number McDonald’s

item.title: Sending the F.B.I. my reference for the case targeting McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering + additional warnings
item.description:
On 2022-04-28, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to give them my reference for the case targeting the transnational criminal enterprise McDonald’s Corporation for fraud and money laundering.

I am also reminding the F.B.I. that the law firm representing McDonald’s France was Péchenard & Associés, a law firm which belongs to and/or used to belong to the parents of the former General Director of the French National Police.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist)

SUBJECT: Case number McDonald’s

item.title: Whistle-blower asking the F.B.I. if they received and kept the emails which were sent in 2015 and if they ever launched a criminal investigation against McDonald’s Corporation
item.description:
On 2022-04-20, I sent an email to the F.B.I. to ask them if they ever received the emails I sent them back in 2015 regarding the major case targeting McDonald’s Corporation.

I also ask the F.B.I. if they ever launched a criminal investigation targeting the transnational criminal enterprise.

FROM : X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

TO : Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department), Mahonri Manjarrez (FBI language specialist)

SUBJECT: Has the FBI ever received the emails I sent in 2015?

item.title: Email sent to the F.B.I. about Xi Jinping (习近平), the President of the People’s Republic of China, and Li Keqiang (李克强), the Premier of the State Council of the People’s Republic of China.

Subject: XiJinping.fr and LiKeqiang.org

FROM : Adam Rogalski (Legal Attaché/State Department)

SUBJECT: Request to contact FBI office in Beijing

item.title: Reply from McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: Global Compliance Office of McDonald’s Corporation <business.integrity@us.mcd.com> Subject: Re: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date received: November 19, 2019 at 01:19 (Beijing time) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) - Our apologies for not responding, however, it appears that we did not receive your communications. Could you provide us with the information that you previously provided? Thanks. Click on this link to visualize the original email: 2019-11-19-reply-from-mcdonalds-global-compliance-office_Redacted.

item.title: Email to McDonald’s Global Compliance Office
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Have you received my communications? Please acknowledge receipt. Date sent: November 18, 2019, 23:16 (Beijing time) To: Global Compliance Office of McDonald’s Corporation <business.integrity@us.mcd.com> Dear Sir or Madam, Have you received my communications? I would appreciate if you would confirm the receipt of the emails I’ve sent to you. Have all of the Members of the Board of McDonald’s Corporation been notified? It’s important for all of them to be notified of what’s going on.

item.title: The Math Equation That Tried to Stump the Internet - The New York Times
item.description: Type of evidence: article by Steven Strogatz published in The New York Times Original source: https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/02/science/math-equation-pedmas-bemdas-bedmas.html Archive: Click on this link to visualize the original document: The-Math-Equation-That-Tried-to-Stump-the-Internet-The-New-York-Times.pdf

item.title: Hunger Strike. Reply from French Law Professor Yves Strickler
item.description: Note: this email has been redacted for brevity. Check the French version of this page for the full content. Key point: French law professor Yves Strickler didn’t disapprove the possibility for me to do a hunger strike to protest the repeated violations of my fundamental rights by France. For the record, I am now accusing McDonald’s of having corrupted French officials. It might help to explain why McDonald’s France and McDonald’s Corporation, and their accomplices, have never been indicted for serious fraud and money laundering in France.

item.title: Email to McDonald’s executives about Allen & Overy
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: : Allen & Overy Date sent: January 4, 2016 at 21:48 (China Standard Time) To: Steve Easterbrook, Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com>, Malcolm Hicks <Malcolm.Hicks@eu.mcd.com> Mr. Easterbrook, Ms. Santona, Mr. Hicks, Could you please let me know the name of the lawyer who is representing you at Allen & Overy? I’ve just tried to call them but I can’t get anyone without the right person’s name.

item.title: Additional frauds; email sent to McDonald’s General Counsel CCed to McDonald’s CEO
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: additional frauds Date sent: 2015-10-22 11:06 (Beijing time +0800) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook Ms Santona, Thank you for answering me. Could you please make sure the French team communicate with me by email? Normal mail takes forever for me to receive now that I live in China and I am not going to wait one month to act if there is an ongoing fraud.

item.title: 4th formal notice sent to the executives of McDonald’s Corporation to keep warning them that McDonald’s France has engaged in a pattern of racketeering activity
item.description: From: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court) Subject: Translation of yesterday’s email Date sent: October 21, 2015, 12:01 (Beijing time) To: Gloria Santona <Gloria.Santona@us.mcd.com> Cc: Steve Easterbrook, Robert Gibbs (Robert.Gibbs@us.mcd.com), Silvia Lagnado (Silvia.Lagnado@us.mcd.com), Kevin Ozan <Kevin.Ozan@us.mcd.com>, Jim Sappington (Jim.Sappington@us.mcd.com), Mike Andres <Mike.Andres@us.mcd.com> PLEASE FIND HERE THE TRANSLATION OF THE EMAIL I SENT YOU YESTERDAY. Mesdames, Messieurs, Dear Sir or Madam, Je vous ordonne de faire cesser immédia

item.title: Evidence - law review article by McDonald’s attorney
item.description: Type of evidence: law review article written by McDonald’s attorney Éric Andrieu from the Péchenard & Associés law firm. Click on this link to visualize the original document: evidence-law-review-article-from-mcdonalds-attorney-may-2014-european-parliament.pdf Highlighting McDonald’s legal counsel Éric Andrieu’s association with the Péchenard & Associés law firm, it’s noteworthy that he authored a law review article published on May 1, 2014. In this piece, he references the European Parliament’s resolution dated February 4, 2014, concerning the Unfair Commercial Practices Directive 2005/29/EC (2013/2116(INI)).

item.title: McDonald’s France 2013 Scratch-to-Win fraud - evidence
item.description: Click on this link to visualize the original document: Scratch-To-Win-McDonald_s_Low-360p.mp4

item.title: “I sold my soul to McDonald’s”
item.description: This book contains a crucial evidence that McDonald’s Corporation executives could have easily, through a simple phone call, stop the ongoing frauds which were happening in France, and later in Europe. Then, why didn’t they? In addition to the fact that there is an undeniable proof that, contrarily to what Gloria Santona said, this was a French problem, the book offers additional insights about how McDonald’s seems to corrupt politicians. To gain a clearer understanding of the sequence of events in this case, I invite you to view a detailed timeline at the following link:

item.title: Business Insider erroneous article about the McDonald’s Monopoly fraud
item.description: Type of evidence: article from Business Insider Original source: https://www.businessinsider.com/math-mcdonalds-monopoly-odds-probability-2013-7 Here is an archive that I keep for the record: Click on this link to visualize the original document: evidence-McDonalds-criminal-RICO-case-2013-07-17-business-insider-article.pdf

item.title: Françoise de Borda, former general counsel of McDonald’s France
item.description:
Via certified mail with proof of receipt requested

From: Françoise de Borda (Francoise.deBorda@fr.mcd.com) To: X. (Anonymity granted by decision of the Court)

If I recall correctly, a copy of the mail was sent to a French Ministerial Officer who I now accuse of being corrupted.

Translation coming soon. (Note of 2023-04-13: quick note, this event happened in 2012 and I published it, if I am not mistaken, on 2022-09-21T20:49:00+08:00. Back then I wrote “translation coming soon” but I currently don’t have time to translate what was said in French. It’s an important event but not that important compared to what I am currently explaining to the FBI which is the priority.)

Françoise de Borda, directrice juridique de McDonald’s France, me réponds pour la première et pour la dernière fois. Elle ment.

item.title: McDonald’s Corporation v. Simon Marketing 2002-09-16 - evidence
item.description: Key takeaway: McDonald’s Corporation and its executives knew perfectly well, in 2015, that McDonald’s Corporation and its subsidiary companies were engaging in a pattern of racketeering activity. “MEMORANDUM OPINION AND ORDER MATTHEW F. KENNELLY, United States District Judge. […] McDonald’s asserts seven claims against the defendants. Counts 1 and 2 are claims under the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act against Jacobson and the other individual defendants, charging them with conducting Simon’s affairs through a pattern of racketeering activity and conspiring to do so.
